column4: how can I permanently deny a progarm access to the keyring? Evolution is driving me crazy
seahorse -> password -> login -> Delete the needed prog
yes, but I dont see the program that triggers the  popup, so i'm waiting for the popup to come back again
You don't need that. Hit alt+f2, type "seahorse", hit enter, delete evolution from there
I dont want to completely block evolution. Its just the popup has "allow once", "denie once" and "allow permanently". I want the "deny permanently" option
If you have aptitude installed, try using that
It reports problems in a very descriptive way
I have aptitude installed, running it now
this is the output aptitude gives: http://paste.ubuntu.com/660374/
Huh... wow, this is a mess, I can't make sense of it :(
Ask someone with a better APT knowledge I guess, sorry.
no problem, thanks for your time
wols: I know, I was just hoping there would be some apt or dpkg magick known to get me out of this mess
Unfortunately the channel policy does not allow us to support derivs
wols: I understand. Thanks a lot for you time, I will try the bodhi forum if I cant work it out
You need any web server. They all are about equally simple to setup, just search for something lightweight (lighttpd?)
Ignore jalexandru. That will only work if you already have a web server installed, and none come on the default Ubuntu setup. Install one first.
